title: Electric potential isolines at two points

content.description: A sphere with charge <math alttext="q" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is fixed at the bottom left corner of the right triangle shown in the figure. Points <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are at the locations shown.
content.question: Which of the following diagrams best shows isolines of electric potential in the vicinity of points <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: The figure presents a diagram with point q at the bottom left, and two curved dashed lines around it. The first curved line is close to point q, and has point P on it. There is a second curved line surrounding this and is further away, with point R on it.

The figure presents a diagram of a curved dashed line with points R and P on it. Point R is near the top, and point P is near the bottom. The point q is at the bottom left of the diagram, and on the inside of the curved line.

The figure presents a diagram with two vertical dashed lines. Point R is near the top of the line to the right, and point P is near the bottom of the line on the left. Point q is at the bottom of the diagram, to the left of both lines.

The figure presents a diagram with a vertical dashed line with point P at the bottom. There is a diagonal, dashed line with point R on it at the top right of the diagram, and point q is shown at the bottom left of the diagram.

content.answer: The figure presents a diagram with point q at the bottom left, and two curved dashed lines around it. The first curved line is close to point q, and has point P on it. There is a second curved line surrounding this and is further away, with point R on it.
